title: 175 followers problem!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the number of real values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \\left( x+\\dfrac { 1 }{ x }  \\right)  }^{ 175 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the double of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 175 }+\\dfrac { 1 }{ { x }^{ 175 } } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

title: 17 divisors
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the smallest positive integer with exactly 17 positive divisors?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the prime number decomposition of a number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = p_1^{e_1} \cdot p_2^{e_2} \cdots,"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
then every divisor "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d | N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has the form
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d = p_1^{a_1} \cdot p_2^{a_2} \cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0 \leq a_i \leq e_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". There are
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta(N) = (e_1+1)\cdot (e_2+1)\cdots "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
ways to choose the exponents "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta(N) = 17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since 17 is prime, we can only have one prime "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e_1 + 1 = 17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = p_1^{16}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
The smallest possible choice for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is 2, so
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 2^{16} = \boxed{65\:536}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Wow, what an amazing puzzle to tease coworkers, and an unexpected insight into the NT! I never looked into the number of divisors before, and the amazing facts pop out immediately: "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
(1) the number of divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d(n)=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" iff "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a prime; generalizing, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
(2) every divisor is a product of 0 to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of every factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the multiplicity "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so for the factoring "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=\prod p_i^{k_i}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", every divisor is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\prod p_i^{\{0,...,k_i\}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and, since any combination of the prime factors yields a unique divisor, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d(n)=\prod (k_i+1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is, curiously, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
(3) odd iff "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a square (all terms in the product are odd iff all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are even, i.e. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a square). "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
(4) Also, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d(n)=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" iff "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a square of a prime (divisors being "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\{1,p,p^2=n\}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and, generalizing, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
(5) "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d(n)=k+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k^\mathrm{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power of a prime; even stronger, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
(6) "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d(n)=k+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  iff "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k^\mathrm{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power of a prime and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d(n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" itself is a prime, so that its computation in (2) is a unique factoring with a single term, which immediately yields a solution."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"More stuff on topic: "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
https://oeis.org/A000005 - a lot of references there. The low OEIS sequence number 5, wow! "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
https://terrytao.wordpress.com/2008/09/23/the-divisor-bound/ "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
https://terrytao.files.wordpress.com/2009/01/whatsnew.pdf, p. 59: same as above, expanded."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For a little numeric fun, following the Tao's paper, the mean
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M(N) = \frac 1 N \sum_{n=1+s}^{N+s} \frac{\ln n}{d(n)} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
(with a small "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s=10000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to offset the likely irregularities in the range of small "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") grows, albeit excruciatingly slowly: for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=\{1,2,5,10,20,50,100\} \times 10^6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M(N)=\{1.931, 1.982, 2.049, 2.099, 2.147, 2.210, 2.261\}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The log-log mean,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M'(N) = \frac 1 N \sum_{n=1+s}^{N+s} \frac{\ln \ln n}{d(n)}, "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
on the other hand, falls as the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" grows: for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=\{1,3,10,30\} \times 10^6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M'(N)=\{0.383548, 0.380563, 0.377107, 0.373889 \}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 2^{a_{1}} \cdot 3^{a_{2}} \cdots p_{n}^{a_{n}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the number of divisors = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\bigg(a_{1} + 1\bigg)\cdot\bigg(a_{2} + 1\bigg)\cdots \cdot\bigg(a_{n} + 1\bigg) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is prime it cannot be factorised as a product of two numbers other than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \times 17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus, to have the smallest possible value, we assign "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"17 = a_{1} + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 = a_{2} + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies a_{1} = 16, a_{2} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore N = 2^{(16)} \cdot 3^{(0)} = 2^{16} = \boxed{65536}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I like how you have periodically solved it

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Factors of 17 = 17 and 1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Subtract 1 from each factor = 16 and 0 = 16"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{16}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"65536"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I made  an error while typing, I should have said that 17 being a prime number instead of an odd number.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            The fact that 17 is odd tells you that the answer is a square; but it doesn't immediately follow that it is a power of two."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For instance, the smallest number with 15 divisors is 144, not "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{14} = 16384"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}
